page.title: 12POSTAL SERVICES (CONTINUED)
page.content: and all the normal post office things like stamps and pensions. We asked him if he would like to sell anything else but he said there was no demand as most people had cars and could easily get to town. He does not want to make any changes. By contrast the post office at Colesbourne is a mini supermarket as well as post office. Almost anything can be bought for everyday needs. It is quite different from Coberley post office being modern and equipped with facilities like a deep freeze. Colesbourne post office is by a main road and a popular inn. It is also 8 miles from the nearest shops whereas Coberley is just under 4 miles from shops and tucked away in the little hamlet of Coberley. Perhaps these reasons are why the two rural post offices have developed differently.
